title: (x) equivalent for square shaded sans - various {gang}
content:
I showed this to my client and he wanted me to make this font for his website. Well, there isn't time or budget to do this, so I would like to find something similar. I could even add the drop shadow effect myself if you all knew of a close enough font.   
   
thanks.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/47546.gif)
author: markatos

comments.content:
well, the closest I can come is FF Gothic crossed with Copperplate (sort of similar serifs).   
   
any thoughts?
Peter, I'd just go with Copperplate, your going to add the effect anyway.

[Amarillo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/amarillo.shtml) is kind of close but maybe too many spurs, and [Bank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bank-gothic-ef/medium/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=STABILIMENTI+FOTOTIPOGRAFIA) with no spurs at all.

[Amarillo](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903/http:/www.letterheadfonts.com/contributors/chuckdavis/amarillo.shtml) is kind of close but maybe too many spurs, and [Bank Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/bank-gothic-ef/medium/?PREFS_SET%5BRenderSize%5D=36&PREFS_SET%5BRenderString%5D=STABILIMENTI+FOTOTIPOGRAFIA) with no spurs at all.

thanks ignacio. I'm amazed at how the caps in Bank Gothic are virtually identical to FF Gothic.   
   
I ended up making the letters i needed. was fun.

[http://www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=115&page=6](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518052903/http:/www.dafont.com/en/theme.php?cat=115&page=6)   
   
pretty similar flavor... is Hominis found @ dafont
